keyword: how many calories in a beef patty
title: How Many Calories in a Beef Patty?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a beef patty, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per patty, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Beef Patty?
assumptions: Standard 4 oz (113 g) cooked ground beef patty, 80% lean/20% fat, grilled without added oil or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by leanness, size, cooking method, and brand; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard beef patty contains about 290 kcal and 25 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a beef patty?
faqs.a: Approximately 290 kcal for a standard 4 oz 80% lean cooked patty.

faqs.q: What's the protein in one beef patty?
faqs.a: About 25 g of protein per patty.
No carbs, fiber, or sugars in a plain beef patty.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in a beef patty?
faqs.a: Grilling keeps it lower; frying adds calories from oil absorption.

faqs.q: What makes a beef patty higher in fat?
faqs.a: Higher fat content (e.g., 70/30 lean) increases fat and calories significantly.
